image.altText: Victorian Opposition Leader John Pesutto stands at a podium with media microphones, with three colleagues standing behind him.

props.synopsis: Liberal MPs are unsure whether Victorian Opposition Leader John Pesutto's Federal Court loss spells the end of his tenure.

title.children: A humiliating courtroom defeat might not be the end of Pesutto

image.altText: A pink bunny rabbit child's toy sitting on the ground with other toys blurred in the background.

props.synopsis: Four children aged between six months and 15 years old were violently killed in Victoria between 2016 and 2017. A coroner has called for the creation of a Child Protection taskforce in the wake of a damning report into the deaths.

title.children: Child protection failures led to four Victorian children's deaths, inquest finds

image.altText: The exterior of the County Court of Victoria in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The man is accused of sexually assaulting a woman after allegedly drinking alcohol and taking cocaine with her at his home.

title.children: High-profile Melbourne man accused of rape wins court bid to conceal his identity

image.altText: Forrest Caves memorial

props.synopsis: The Victorian Coroner as urged precaution at Australian beaches following an investigation into the drownings of four family members in Phillip Island in January.

title.children: Coroner delivers findings into Victoria's worst beach tragedy in 20 years

image.altText: Adam Kneale and attorneys walking to a courthouse

props.synopsis: The largest payout to an abuse survivor in Australia, a $5.9 million award against the Western Bulldogs, has been reduced by more than half on appeal.

title.children: AFL club's payout to abuse survivor Adam Kneale reduced to $2.6 million

image.altText: A girl and her family.

props.synopsis: After an exam period marred by controversy, Victorian students receive their VCE exam results, with 41 Victorian students achieving the highest possible ATAR rank of 99.95.

title.children: Mixed emotions as VCE results arrive after exams marred by controversy

image.altText: A collection of scrolled parchments.

props.synopsis: As counter-terrorism police investigate the torching of a Melbourne synagogue on Friday, its community is fighting to save priceless Torah scrolls damaged in the arson attack.

title.children: Each scroll damaged in Melbourne's synagogue blaze 'has its own story'

image.altText: A school photo of a teenaged boy

props.synopsis: Kilvington Grammar and the organiser of a school trip have both apologised in court for the death of a diabetic 16-year-old student in 2019.

title.children: Melbourne school formally pleads guilty over death of Lachlan Cook

image.altText: A bombed out multi-storey building surrounded by debris in Gaza.

props.synopsis: The latest bloodshed occurred just hours after the UN General Assembly called for an immediate ceasefire in the devastated territory, with Australia supporting the motion but the US and Israel opposing it.

title.children: Guards protecting aid trucks in Gaza killed by Israeli strikes

image.altText: Artist Anthony Lister outside NSW District Court

props.synopsis: A jury was unable to decide on charges relating to two other women who alleged they were sexually assaulted by the 44-year-old artist.

title.children: Artist Anthony Lister can be identified as man at centre of long-running sexual assault trial

image.altText: A search box for a careers website.

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate falls to 3.9pc in November, down from 4.1pc in October.

title.children: Unemployment hits 3.9pc, threatening near-term interest rate cuts

image.altText: Large billboard of man with politcal slogans

props.synopsis: Hardline youth justice law changes to sentence young offenders as adults for more than a dozen serious crimes pass Queensland parliament.

title.children: Tough youth justice laws pass Queensland parliament

image.altText: A crowd of people walking along a street carrying shopping bags on an overcast day.

props.synopsis: All states and territories experienced population growth during the past 12 months, some much faster than others.

title.children: Australia's population grows by 552,000 despite births at 17-year low

image.altText: Woman speaks at press conference in front of police officer

props.synopsis: The NT chief minister and police commissioner have flagged federal support may be called upon for Alice Springs, in response to what they describe as "serious, heinous, and escalating violence" in the town.

title.children: Chief flags possible federal support to address Alice Springs crime

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walking into court.

props.synopsis: An indictment alleging Bruce Lehrmann raped a woman in Queensland in October 2021 has been presented to the Toowoomba District Court.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann alleged rape indictments presented to court

image.altText: Candace Owens holds two fingers up while speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: Australian Immigration Minister Tony Burke barred Ms Owens from entry in October, noting she has denied that Nazis conducted medical experimentation on Jewish people in concentration camps during World War II.

title.children: NZ reverses visa refusal for Candace Owens after Australia ban

image.altText: A dark-haired, bespectacled man in a radio studio in the 1970s.

props.synopsis: Clive Robertson was famous for breaking the rules of his profession and his often-humorous exchanges with fellow broadcaster Margaret Throsby.

title.children: ABC's 'one-off' broadcaster Clive Robertson dies aged 78

props.synopsis: A man and woman were stuck on the roof of their submerged four-wheel drive for hours in remote WA after being swept away while trying to cross a river.

title.children: Stranded teachers rescued from car roof in rising outback floodwaters

image.altText: Emil Petrov wears a black waterproof jacket over a cream coloured shirt and has brown rimmed glasses resting on his forehead.

props.synopsis: A jury finds Emil "Bill" Petrov guilty of the violent murder of Cindy Crossthwaite in her Melton South home in Melbourne's north-west in 2007.

title.children: Family remember 'beautiful girl' as husband found guilty of murder

image.altText: A man flying a two-seater airplane, wearing a headset

props.synopsis: Background noise, lights or smells can turn an everyday task into a nightmare for people with sensory differences, but some key adjustments can make spaces more inclusive.

title.children: Finding quiet places in a noisy world helps people like Corey avoid a meltdown

image.altText: An illustration of three women looking towards the camera.

props.synopsis: For generations words like fat, obese and overweight have been thrown around like hand grenades. In medical settings, the damage dealt can last generations. And the victims are overwhelmingly female.

title.children: The hidden impact of fat shaming in Australia's medical system

image.altText: A white man wearing a suit and glasses with a concerned look on his face speaks

props.synopsis: Facebook, Google and TikTok will be made to pay for Australian journalism even if they drop it from their platforms, and Australia joins a UN resolution calling for an immediate, permanent and unconditional ceasefire in Gaza. Catch up on how the day unfolded across our blog.

title.children: Tech giants unhappy at new tax to fund news content — as it happened

image.altText: Prince Abdulaziz bin Turki Al Faisal wearing white and brown robes and shawls while smiling with hands raised

props.synopsis: The Middle Eastern nation has won the right to host the tournament in 2034 despite major concerns migrant workers could die constructing the event.

title.children: Saudi Arabia to host FIFA World Cup despite sportswashing concerns

image.altText: A composite shows pictures of Rio Tinto and BHP signs atop tall buildings.

props.synopsis: Lawyers say hundreds of women have joined a lawsuit that alleges widespread and systemic sexual harassment and gender discrimination at Rio Tinto and BHP worksites.

title.children: Mining companies called out for using NDAs to 'blackmail' women

image.altText: A white man wearing a suit and glasses with a concerned look on his face speaks

props.synopsis: Facebook, Google and TikTok will be made to pay for Australian journalism even if they drop it from their platforms, under a new tax being planned by the federal government. Follow live

title.children: TikTok unhappy at new tax on social giants to fund news content

image.altText: A Rex Airlines plane stands on a runway.

props.synopsis: Taking on Regional Express and four of its directors represents a change of attitude at the corporate regulator that has been missing in action for years, if not decades.

title.children: An attitude shift led the corporate regulator to set its sights on Rex

image.altText: Chrsi Wray wearing a dark suit and blue tie with lips pursed as he looks up and leans to his right

props.synopsis: FBI director Chris Wray will step down from his position in January, after US president-elect Donald Trump signalled his intent to fire him and replace him with Kash Patel.

title.children: FBI director to step down before Trump administration takes power

image.altText: Supporters of Hezbollah gather waving yellow flags and the flag of Lebanon in Beirut

props.synopsis: The fall of Syrian president Bashar Al-assad has dealt another major blow to Iran's so-called "Axis of Resistance", coming as Hamas and Hezbollah were already weakened. Now the future of the alliance is being questioned.

title.children: Fall of Assad 'another nail in the coffin' for Iran's Axis of Resistance

image.altText: Prince Abdulaziz bin Turki Al Faisal wearing white and brown robes and shawls while smiling with hands raised

props.synopsis: The Middle Eastern nation has won the right to host the tournament in 2034 despite major concerns migrant workers could die constructing the event.

title.children: FIFA accused of ignoring human rights concerns picking World Cup host

image.altText: A close-up shows a man with a dark black beard and a turban looking serious.

props.synopsis: A suicide bombing in the Afghan capital killed the Taliban's refugee minister Khalil Haqqani, according to Interior Ministry officials.

title.children: Taliban refugee minister killed in Kabul suicide bombing

image.altText: Israel graffitti

props.synopsis: It comes after anti-Israel vandalism was graffitied in Sydney's east, which is home to one of Australia's largest Jewish communities.

title.children: Police presence increased around Jewish sites in Sydney

image.altText: A family of five Syrian refugees sitting on a brown couch.

props.synopsis: The Alrahmo family has spent eight years making a life in Australia since fleeing war-torn Syria with their six children. Now the Bashar al-Assad regime has fallen, they finally feel safe enough to consider returning home to see loved ones.

title.children: Syrian refugee family hopeful of seeing loved ones after fall of Assad

image.altText: Military vehicles driving up a dirt road along an area separated by barbed wire

props.synopsis: Shortly after Syrian president Bashar al-Assad's overthrow by rebel forces, Israel ordered its troops to enter a demilitarised buffer zone situated along the east of Syria's Golan Heights plateau it controls.

title.children: The history of Syria's Golan Heights and why it is important to Israel

image.altText: Two police officers standing at the back of a white car.

props.synopsis: Questions still remain over the death of a three-month-old baby found in a freezer on a rural New South Wales property in 2022.

title.children: Cause of death of baby found in freezer remains unknown, inquest told

image.altText: Analyn 'Logee' Osias smiles for a selfie with the sun softly shining on tents behind her.

props.synopsis: A court hears James Pualic, who has pleaded guilty to murdering his ex-partner in her Bendigo home, could not regulate his emotions and had a long-standing problem with alcohol and illegal substances.

title.children: Supreme Court hears killer had 'propensity to explode' with rage
